revised_title: Cell Wall Organization and Growth in Filamentous Green Algae: Structure and Formation
tldr: The authors studied the cell wall organization and growth in the filamentous green algae Cladophora and Chaetomorpha using electron microscopy and X-ray diffraction analysis. They discovered three sets of microfibrils in the side walls of the algae cells, which are oriented in different directions. The structure of the side walls can be related to a grid of intersecting lines, and the microfibrils are interwoven within and between lamellae. The findings provide insights into the orientation and deposition of cellulose microfibrils in these species.
